content.question: A particle moves along the x-axis with position at time t given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <msup> <mi>e</mi> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </msup> <mi>sin</mi> <mi>t</mi> <mtext> </mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@434B@</annotation> </semantics> </math> for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mi>π</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DAA@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. (a) Find the time t at which the particle is farthest to the left. Justify your answer.

frqParts.text: A particle moves along the x-axis with position at time t given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <msup> <mi>e</mi> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </msup> <mi>sin</mi> <mi>t</mi> <mtext> </mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@434B@</annotation> </semantics> </math> for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mi>π</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DAA@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. (b) Find the value of the constant A for which x(t) satisfies the equation Ax''(t) + x'(t) + x(t) = 0 for 0 < t < 2<math> <semantics> <mi>π</mi> <annotation>MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaeqiWdahaaa@37B3@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

topic.text: 2.7: Derivatives of cos x, sin x, ex, and ln x
